text: <@U3BA8QYUE|sekharkumarroy> has joined the channel
<@U3AFRMY68> there are a couple of ways you can get running with Fabric
the first is to directly leverage the published Docker images with something we call the Fabric starter kit <http://hyperledger-fabric.readthedocs.io/en/latest/starter/fabric-starter-kit/>
you don't need to build from source; you can just start things with Docker Compose and build off of the provided sample app
this is all currently based on v0.6 images
the second mode is for the more adventurous, and that would involve building from source
however, there isn't much in published documentation on how to get things running
this is coming soon
LMK whether you want to be on the bleeding edge or if you would prefer working with a more stable version of the code
<@U39MD9UC8|name63> has joined the channel
<@U0KM61BCP> thanks a lot, that helped :slightly_smiling_face: Does 0.6 support java as well ?
it should, I suppose. I saw Java and examples
but I can't deploy the chaincode... have you succeeded?
name63 : yes, atleast the node app worked
well.. i've only managed to get validating peer and chaincode started, but i can't deploy it due to Error: Error endorsing chaincode: rpc error: code = 12 desc = unknown service protos.Endorser
but i'm not using vagrant - just docker-compose...
perhaps something is missing...
oh, i finally got it...
i should have run peer chaincode deploy -n mycc -c '{"Args": ["init", "a","100", "b", "200"]}'  on the running peer node
Now I'm running the docker images, can I call the REST on the host machine ?
did not tried it yet, but it should work. CLI worked for me and since docs state that it's just a wrapper around REST client
